title: Joaquin Phoenix Describes The 'Heartbreaker' Scene From Joker That You’ll Never Ever Get To See
text:
Joaquin Phoenix Describes The 'Heartbreaker' Scene From Joker That You’ll Never Ever Get To See

Joaquin Phoenix Describes The 'Heartbreaker' Scene From Joker That You’ll Never Ever Get To See

Which is your favourite scene from Joker? They are plenty that are etched in your hearts and minds, right? And there aren’t enough number of times that you’ll watch Joker to praise the grand cinematic experience that it was.

But strangely, you haven’t watched “one of the best scenes” from the movie yet, and sadly, you’ll never be able to watch it ever.

Twitter

That’s the reason why they don’t make the final cut. They chopped off for a reason, says director Todd Philips adding that he will never show a deleted scene. “I hate f*****g extended cuts. I hate deleted scenes… They’re deleted for a reason. The movie that exists is exactly the movie I want it to be.”

goodfon.com

Joaquin Phoenix said losing one of the scenes was a “heartbreaker” and admitted it “might’ve been the last scene I cut out.”

“There was a scene that, that during the shoot we thought was one of the best scenes and we loved his behavior in the scene, and I’d always really liked the scene. And Todd told me and said, ‘We’re cutting that scene out.’ And at first I thought, like, ‘Wait a minute, what do you mean you cut that scene out?’ And then of course I saw it, and it was very obvious. It has to go.”

milenio.com

What was the scene about? Joaquin Phoenix says it was a scene between Arthur Fleck and co-worker Randall, after Arthur is let go from his clown agency job. In the final cut, he exists the building and messes up with a sign leading down the staircase.

Twitter

Joaquin Phoenix added, “That’s just what’s so cool about movies, right? You can have a great scene, it’s something that makes sense, but the movie is the collection of all of these scenes and they have to work together to tell the story, and it actually made that whole sequence so smooth.”

Joker, meanwhile, has made Rs 50 crores in India already!
